docs-template

An Advanced Sphinx-based Docs Site Template

Site Contents#

Setup

docs-template setup instructions.

Usage

Learn how to use the template to create, personalize, and manage your own docs site.

Resources

Useful reference information including helpful links to design, color, icon, and other resources.

Development

Notes for future docs-template development.

Project Features#

  • Custom Python3 package.

  • Python Packaging and Dependency Management using Poetry

  • Workflow Management via Make

  • Logging via the Python Logging Module

  • Notebooks using JupyterLab

  • Formatting and Linting via:

    • isort

    • black

    • PyLint

    • autoflake

    • PyLama

  • Python Package Documentation Site using Sphinx including:

    • PyData Theme

    • Open Sans font via Google Fonts

    • Sphinx Extensions include:

      • sphinx.ext.autodoc ‚Äì Include documentation from docstrings

      • sphinx.ext.autosectionlabel ‚Äì Allow reference sections using its title

      • sphinx.ext.autosummary ‚Äì Generate autodoc summaries

      • sphinx.ext.graphviz ‚Äì Add Graphviz graphs

      • sphinx.ext.napoleon ‚Äì Support for NumPy and Google style docstrings

      • sphinx.ext.todo ‚Äì Support for todo items

      • sphinx.ext.viewcode ‚Äì Add links to highlighted source code

      • sphinx_git

        • sphinx-git is an extension to the Sphinx documentation tool that allows you to include excerpts from your git history within your documentation. This could be used for release changelogs, to pick out specific examples of history in documentation, or just to surface what is happening in the project.

      • sphinx_markdown_builder ‚Äì sphinx builder that outputs markdown files.

      • sphinx_copybutton ‚Äì add a little ‚Äúcopy‚Äù button to the right of your code blocks.

      • sphinx_design ‚Äì A sphinx extension for designing beautiful, screen-size responsive web-components.

      • myst_parser ‚Äì A Sphinx and Docutils extension to parse MyST, a rich and extensible flavour of Markdown for authoring technical and scientific documentation.

        • Extensions include:

          • amsmath

          • dollarmath

          • smartquotes

          • strikethrough

          • colon_fence

          • deflist

          • tasklist

          • attrs_inline

          • html_image

          • html_admonition

      • sphinxcontrib.mermaid ‚Äì embed Mermaid graphs in your documents, including general flowcharts, sequence and gantt diagrams.

      • sphinx-hoverxref ‚Äì show a floating window (tooltips or modal dialogues) on the cross references of the documentation embedding the content of the linked section on them. With sphinx-hoverxref, you don‚Äôt need to click a link to see what‚Äôs in there.

      • sphinx-sitemap ‚Äì A Sphinx extension to generate multi-version and multi-language sitemaps.org compliant sitemaps for the HTML version of your Sphinx documentation.

      • sphinx_togglebutton ‚Äì A small sphinx extension to add ‚Äútoggle button‚Äù elements to sections of your page. For example:

        • This is a toggle button

      • sphinx_favicon ‚Äì A Sphinx extension to add custom favicons. With Sphinx Favicon, you can add custom favicons to your Sphinx HTML documentation.
